children.text: The tile grout width is inconsistent, which looks poorly finished, and is below the acceptable standard.
The relevant Australian Standard AS 3958.1 Ceramic Tiles - Guide to the Installation of Ceramic Tiles, Clause 5.4.6 - Tile Finish and Joints states that
‘joint widths should be consistent throughout the installation unless specified’ .
Additionally, the Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances, clause 11.06 Grouting and joints states that
‘Joints are defective if they are not, as far as is practicable, of consistent width and can be seen from a normal viewing position’ .
As this is clearly visible, the tiling in this area will need to be removed and re-constructed in accordance with the above requirements.
